translation.en: [interviewer] Okay, we're recording.
[Tyler Barriss] All right.
[interviewer] So, maybe the best place to start is,
how did you get involved in this?
[Barriss] I was in an argument with someone that most people would consider a hacker.
translation.ko: 보통 사람들에게 해커로 통하는 사람과 말다툼을 했어요

translation.en: I was reading the texts on my phone,
and I guess I said something that kind of, I have to assume,
translation.ko: 제가 했던 말이 그 사람의 긍지나 자존심을 건드렸나 봐요

translation.en: like, insulted his pride or his ego or something.
translation.ko: 그 사람의 긍지나 자존심을 건드렸나 봐요

translation.en: And this person sent the SWAT team to my house at midnight.
translation.ko: 그랬더니 한밤중에 우리 집에 특공대를 보냈어요

translation.en: [Barriss] When I looked out my window, I noticed it was really bright outside,
like, really bright.
So then I walked out my room and opened the front door.
And it… I looked up in the sky and there was a helicopter.
translation.ko: 그리고 하늘을 보니 헬리콥터도 와 있었죠

translation.en: The light was so bright that it was…
It seemed like it was mid-afternoon, that's how bright the light was.
translation.ko: 훤한 대낮 같았어요 그 정도로 밝았죠

translation.en: [Barriss] Then shortly after, cop cars started pulling up,
and they were getting out with shotguns and rifles.
[Barriss] It was an eye-opening experience
that-- that he could do that to my house over nothing,
translation.ko: 괜히 그런 일을 할 수 있다니요

translation.en: ,'cause it was a hoax call. Whatever he said, wasn't true.
He said that someone was being held hostage in the closet.
translation.ko: 누군가 벽장에 인질로 잡혀 있다고 했대요

translation.en: I learned later that he even pretended to be
translation.ko: 나중에 알고 보니 제 벽장에 인질로 갇혔다는 여자 행세도 했더라고요

translation.en: the girl that was allegedly being held hostage in my closet.
translation.ko: 제 벽장에 인질로 갇혔다는 여자 행세도 했더라고요

translation.en: I wasn't scared for my life.
I didn't feel like I was gonna die or anything.
I just thought it was cool that he could do that.
[interviewer] You thought it was cool.
[Barriss] That's what I thought about that experience.
Quite frankly, I was thinking, "Holy shit."
"This guy actually just sent the SWAT team to my house,
and he's not worried at all about the consequences."
[woman in phone recording] This call is from a federal prison.
[reporter 1] Now, if you've never heard of swatting…
Honestly, I hadn't until this story happened.
[caller] I've got two people here held hostage, all right?
translation.ko: 여기 두 명이 인질로 잡혀 있어요

translation.en: [reporter 1] It's when someone makes a prank call about a bogus crime
translation.ko: 가짜 범죄에 대한 허위 신고를 뜻하죠

translation.en: to get the SWAT team to go to someone's house.
[reporter 2] An army of Nassau County SWAT teams
descended on a home, guns drawn.
They thought they were responding to a double-murder,
and a suspect who had barricaded himself in the home.
[SWAT officer] Police department search warrant!
[reporter 2] But it all turned out to be a hoax.
Down! Get on the ground!
[reporter 3] The swatting targets are sometimes celebrities like Rihanna and Justin Bieber,
translation.ko: 스와팅 표적에는 리한나와 저스틴 비버 같은 스타도 있지만

translation.en: but are often online gamers.
People making the false 911 calls and then watch live online.
translation.ko: 사람들은 허위 신고를 하고 실시간 온라인으로 지켜보죠

translation.en: Swatting started as a way to, I think,
translation.ko: 스와팅을 시작한 목적은 "브라이언 크레브스 독립 취재 기자"

translation.en: disrupt gaming competitions.
translation.ko: "브라이언 크레브스 독립 취재 기자" 게임 대회 방해였을 거예요

translation.en: Or if they lose an important match, to get back at somebody else.
translation.ko: 아니면 중요한 경기에서 져서 복수할 때 썼는데

translation.en: It goes back more than 20 years.
People playing a video game,
they call the police and mimic the person that they lost to,
translation.ko: 경찰에 전화해 자기를 꺾은 사람의 목소리로

translation.en: and say that they've killed family members
and they see how many people they can get to come down.
I come out of my room, they got guns pointed at me.
[chuckling] I'm like, "Oh my God, I'm gonna die."
[Krebs] A lot of the people involved in swatting
are doing this to somebody gaming online
and a whole bunch of people all over the world are watching it live.
translation.ko: 전 세계 사람들이 실시간으로 인터넷에서 지켜봐요

translation.en: You could tell them. You could tell them, actually.
It's not funny and it's like…
The takeaways is one thing,
but this is, like, police who are saving lives.
-Um… -A waste of police time, whoever did it.
Being able to send the police to kick in someone's door
while this is all on camera,
kind of ups the ante.
People who perpetrate this are looking for bomb dogs, helicopters.
translation.ko: 스와팅 가해자들은 폭탄 탐지견과 헬리콥터를 원해요

translation.en: That's all part of the "fun."
Each swatting incident costs law enforcement on average $10,000.
translation.ko: 스와팅 한 건당 평균 만 달러의 비용이 발생합니다

translation.en: [Krebs] It's about being feared.
It's about being known.
Making the world acknowledge your presence.
For a lot of these individuals, any attention is good attention.
translation.ko: 이런 사람들은 보통 어떤 관심이든 좋아해요

translation.en: Somebody cares enough about me to send the SWAT team to my house?
translation.ko: '우리 집에 특공대를 보낼 만큼 나한테 관심 있어?'

translation.en: I must be important.
[reporter 4] But the FBI's biggest concern, that one day,
translation.ko: FBI의 가장 큰 걱정은 이 장난 전화가 치명적인 사건으로 번질 수 있다는 겁니다

translation.en: these criminal crank calls will turn deadly.
translation.ko: 이 장난 전화가 치명적인 사건으로 번질 수 있다는 겁니다

translation.en: And then we'll change her face, hair, and clothing.
translation.ko: 이제 얼굴과 머리 모양 옷을 바꿔 봐야지

translation.en: Let's go with Gigi, 'cause that's easy.
We'll do a random last name.
I play video games 'cause it's fun for me.
You can be really creative with it sometimes.
Oh my gosh. She looks crazy.
[chuckling] Look at her legs.
What kind of power workouts are you doing?
I deal with anxiety and stuff like that.
When you have anxiety, you tend to like revert in yourself
translation.ko: 불안증이 있으면 자기 안에 틀어박히고 "익명 요구 타일러 배리스의 전 친구"

translation.en: and do things that feel better for you.
translation.ko: "익명 요구 타일러 배리스의 전 친구" 기분이 좋아지는 걸 하죠

translation.en: And this feels better for me sometimes.
translation.ko: 전 게임으로 기분 전환 하곤 해요

translation.en: Ooh, where should we go?
Prettier houses in Oasis Springs.
It starts off as, you know,
you not wanting to deal with real life.
You get validation from the game,
and, at some point it becomes addictive.
You wanna get that validation over and over again.
Look, my neighbors are coming to visit me,
which is not something that happens in real life.
If real life isn't making me feel good and this is,
I'm gonna play this and spend a majority of my time doing this.
translation.ko: 거의 온종일 비디오 게임으로 시간을 보내요

translation.en: Okay, this is Tyler, and it's Christmas Day.
["Jane Doe"] Really, the reason I started gaming was my friend, Tyler.
translation.ko: 사실 제 친구 타일러 때문에 게임을 시작했어요

translation.en: And I just got something on camera that was… kind of entertaining.
["Jane Doe"] We met when I was in the seventh grade,
he taught me how to play games.
He was the first boyfriend I ever had.
["Jane Doe"] He delved into the gaming community,
and didn't really get outside of the house.
His father died when he was younger.
His mother, she moved to Vegas and they lost contact.
translation.ko: 엄마는 라스베이거스로 이사 가면서 연락이 끊겼어요

translation.en: His grandmother, I know her as his mom,
translation.ko: 할머니는… 엄마라고 부르길래 엄마인 줄 알았죠

translation.en: that's what he called her.
But he wasn't the same online as he was in person.
translation.ko: 온라인상의 타일러는 직접 만날 때랑 달랐어요

translation.en: [Koerner] Playing Halo, the Xbox game,
translation.ko: "브렌던 I 코어너 '와이어드' 객원 편집자" 엑스박스 게임 '헤일로'는

translation.en: became the most important thing in Tyler's life at a very young age.
translation.ko: 아주 어릴 때부터 타일러에게 가장 중요해졌어요

translation.en: He had aspirations of becoming a professional Halo player.
[Krebs] People who are good at this,
their name can be widely known very quickly.
There are competitions all over the world
where people who basically do nothing
but play a specific game or set of games,
come together and compete against each other.
[announcer] If he can continue to hold this down for just a couple more seconds,
translation.ko: 그는 몇 초 더 쓰러져 있었는데요

translation.en: a perfect kill for Royal2.
And that's gonna do it, folks! They are the Halo world champions.
[Krebs] The top prizes for these can be just astronomical.
Endorsements, that kind of thing.
You're gonna sit there behind your mother's computer screen…
translation.ko: 엄마 컴퓨터 앞에 앉아 있는 주제에

translation.en: You ain't got shit to say, bitch!
[Koerner] There is coarseness to gaming culture.
[gamer 1] You dumb cunt.
Learn how to play a proper character, you fucking stupid whore.
translation.ko: 캐릭터 공부 좀 해 이 골 빈 걸레야

translation.en: There is a treatment of others, even that are friends,
that can be quite harsh.
-[gamer 2] Shut the fuck up-- -[gamer 3] Shut the fuck up piece of shit!
[Koerner] Slight infractions invite retaliation, name-calling.
translation.ko: 조금만 실수해도 보복하고 욕이 쏟아져요 "무슨 개소리야?"

translation.en: Real harassment and abuse can be part of this.
translation.ko: 심각한 괴롭힘과 학대가 있죠 "알지도 못하고 지껄이네, 닥쳐!"

translation.en: In the gaming culture that Tyler belonged to,
to be extreme is something that's welcomed and invited.
And extreme is also included with fun.
[Koerner] These Halo acquaintances he had were really his closest friends.
Tyler Barriss was raised by Halo in many ways.
[interviewer] Tell me about how you got into this.
Like, what was your first bomb threat?
[Barriss] My first bomb threat or the first time I sent a SWAT team to someone's house?
translation.ko: 첫 폭탄 협박이요? 처음 남의 집에 특공대 보낸 거요?

translation.en: [interviewer] Yeah, I assume the bomb threats came first, right?
[Barriss] Yeah, that was the first thing I ever tried was evacuating a building.
translation.ko: 네, 처음엔 건물에서 사람들을 대피시키려고 했죠

translation.en: The same person who swatted me sent the bomb squad to a school.
translation.ko: 저한테 특공대를 보낸 사람이 학교에 폭탄 처리반도 보냈거든요

translation.en: The first thing that I wanted to try to do was make headlines like that.
translation.ko: 저도 처음에 그런 식으로 화제가 되고 싶었죠

translation.en: I tried evacuating a college university.
That was the first thing that I ever tried to evacuate
and it was on the news the same day.
At that point, I knew, "Okay, since that worked, this is legit."
translation.ko: 그때 그 방법이 먹히자 이게 되는구나 싶었고

translation.en: Like, I could probably do this to any location in the United States.
translation.ko: 이제 미국 어디서든 할 수 있겠다고 생각했죠

translation.en: It'll get evacuated as long as the call sounds believable.
translation.ko: 말만 그럴듯하게 하면 사람들이 대피할 거고

translation.en: Wherever I do this is going to get evacuated.
[Koerner] So, Tyler starts to swat other people in the Halo community.
But not only that, starts making lots of bomb threat calls
translation.ko: 폭탄 협박 전화도 많이 했죠 "JR 아널드 고등학교 플로리다"

translation.en: to high schools and junior highs.
He would call up and say, "I've hidden a bomb in a locker."
translation.ko: "킨 고등학교 뉴햄프셔" 전화해서 폭탄을 사물함에 숨겼다고 했어요

translation.en: And, of course, they had to close the school.
translation.ko: 물론 학교는 폐쇄해야 했죠 "킨 고등학교에 폭탄 협박 전화가 왔습니다"

translation.en: [Barriss] I had gone on a spree of evacuating high schools,
translation.ko: 전 여러 고등학교에 대피령을 내렸고 "폭탄 협박으로 킨 고교에 경찰 출동"

translation.en: and I was just making it quite obvious on my Twitter
translation.ko: "오후 2시 5분 경찰과 소방관 출동" 제 트위터에 대놓고 올렸어요 "학교에 폭발물 설치"

translation.en: that I'm evacuating numerous schools around the country.
And I have the ability to do this. And then I wanted to--
translation.ko: 그럴 수 있었어요 "가짜 폭탄 협박에 대학 수업 중지"

translation.en: [interviewer] This is a time in which there's a lot of school shootings.
translation.ko: - 그리고… - 학교 총격 사건이 많은 시기죠

translation.en: Did that factor into your thinking?
[Barriss] I wasn't-- It had nothing to do with school shootings.
I was saying there's bombs in the school, they're going to detonate.
I never tried to do no school shooting script or anything like that.
translation.ko: 학교 총격 쪽은 생각도 안 해 봤어요

translation.en: [interviewer] But people are on edge
because there are so many school shootings around the country.
Did that factor into your thinking?
[Barriss] That wasn't… that didn't make me think I was going to have
any more success in having something evacuated.
It wasn't a relevant factor in my mind.
translation.ko: 전 그걸 계산해서 한 일이 아니에요

translation.en: [Barriss] It's the fact that I knew I was breaking the law
and I could get away with it.
And there was nothing they could do to stop me.
I could keep doing it.
I could literally talk to law enforcement over the phone,
lie to them, do something illegal,
send them somewhere, have a place evacuated,
it's coming on the news and there was nothing they could do about it.
They couldn't find me, couldn't arrest me. Nothing they could do.
translation.ko: 저를 못 잡았고 할 수 있는 게 없었어요

translation.en: So I could do that as much as I wanted.
I was… I was like, unstoppable, you could say.
["Jane Doe"] A lot of people praised him.
People being like, "Wow, you're so cool,"
or, "Wow, can't believe you're doing this and not getting caught." Stuff like that.
He's never had a job, doesn't have any working skills.
translation.ko: 타일러는 취직한 적 없고 직업 기술도 없어요

translation.en: He did not graduate from high school.
Swatting was a way for him to earn notoriety.
translation.ko: 스와팅은 악명을 얻을 수 있는 수단이었죠

translation.en: It was about impressing other kids, or other gamers online
and showing them that you could do other things online than just game.
translation.ko: 온라인에서 게임 말고 이런 것도 할 수 있다고 보여 줬죠

translation.en: I kind of had to tell him, like,
"You don't really understand how the real world works."
"People do get caught for the things that they do."
[Koerner] Tyler's grandmother found it very difficult to understand him.
translation.ko: 타일러 할머니는 그런 손자를 이해하지 못했어요

translation.en: There was a volatility to her relationship with Tyler.
And she grew frightened of him.
[Koerner] In September of 2015,
his grandmother is watching KABC TV newscast in Los Angeles.
translation.ko: 2015년 9월, 타일러의 할머니는 로스앤젤레스의 KABC TV 뉴스를 보고 있었어요

translation.en: And he says to his grandmother,
"Do you think I could clear out that building?"
[Barriss] This is when I had just started. I was sending the bomb squad to schools
translation.ko: 그때는 초기였어요 학교에 폭탄 처리반을 보내고

translation.en: and having the schools evacuated just to have it come on the news.
And I wanted to evacuate something kind of bigger.
Instead of having the news report on a school that got evacuated,
translation.ko: 그냥 학교를 대피시켜서 뉴스에 나오는 대신

translation.en: why don't I just evacuate the news studio itself?
It's unusual for those who report the news to become the news.
translation.ko: 뉴스 팀이 뉴스가 되는 일은 드문데

translation.en: Well, that's what happened today to the staff at KABC, in Southern California.
translation.ko: 오늘 남부 캘리포니아의 KABC 직원들이 그런 경험을 했죠

translation.en: The station had to do its four o'clock newscast
from a lawn down the street
after a bomb threat forced everyone in that building to evacuate.
translation.ko: 폭탄 협박으로 건물 안의 모든 사람이 대피한 후였죠

translation.en: [Barriss] They were actually broadcasting live on Channel 7 News
when I made the phone call.
So I thought it would be interesting to make that call,
translation.ko: 그래서 전화하면 재밌겠다 싶었죠 "ABC 7에 폭탄 협박"

translation.en: and watch the TV and see what happened on the TV.
[reporter] A bomb squad and search dogs combed through the building,
translation.ko: 폭탄 처리반과 수색견이 건물을 샅샅이 뒤졌는데

translation.en: eventually ruling it safe to re-enter.
[Koerner] Tyler's grandmother immediately suspects Tyler
and confronts him. And says, "I know you did this."
translation.ko: 네 짓인 거 다 안다는 식으로 말했죠

translation.en: He says, "Yes, I did it."
"But you will not tell another living soul
or else I will beat you bloody and I will blow up our house."
translation.ko: 발설하면 할머니를 때리고 집을 날리겠다고 했죠

translation.en: And she's terrified.
However, she has a longtime friend who's a college police officer
translation.ko: 하지만 할머니의 오랜 친구가 대학 경찰관이라

translation.en: and she confides in him the fact that Tyler did this bomb threat.
translation.ko: 그에게 타일러가 폭탄 협박을 했다고 털어놨죠

translation.en: [Dorroh] My primary job is,
I'm an explosives investigator for the bomb squad.
Back in September, October 2015,
there were a series of swatting incidents
that were being called in across the country.
There were also cases involving bomb threats,
and we weren't sure at the time if they were all related or not.
But on September 29th,
I responded to two school bomb threats in the San Fernando Valley.
translation.ko: 샌퍼낸도밸리의 학교가 폭탄 협박을 받아 출동했죠 "조지 K 포터 중학교"

translation.en: One was at a junior high, one was at an elementary school.
We took the police reports,
and then got in contact with the Glendale police officers.
They advised me that they had arrested a person by the name of Tyler Barriss
translation.ko: "글렌데일 경찰" 타일러 배리스라는 사람을 체포했다는 거예요

translation.en: after calling in a bomb threat to the news stations there in Glendale.
translation.ko: 글렌데일의 뉴스 방송국에 폭탄 협박 전화를 해서요

translation.en: That's the first time I heard his name.
I had to take and piece together the forensic trail.
The first thing I did was met up with the 14-year-old student
who took the telephone call at the office at the middle school.
We played the audio recordings for six different swatting calls that I had.
translation.ko: "조지 K 포터 중학교" 우린 6건의 스와팅 녹취 파일을 들어 봤어요

translation.en: And as soon as we hit the, uh, Tyler Barriss audio recordings,
she was like… she knew exactly.
She was emphatic that was him.
[Dorroh] Tyler Barriss has a distinctive voice.
When I get these different calls, I typically give them a title
translation.ko: 이런 전화를 받으면 전 특징을 포착하고

translation.en: so I can keep them all.
You know, "mush-mouth," "baritone." Something along those lines.
With Tyler Barriss, I used the word "snide."
[Koerner] Tyler became very adept at covering his tracks.
translation.ko: 타일러는 능숙하게 자기 흔적을 지우게 됐어요

translation.en: He always used the voice over IP services
to call from numbers that would dead-end somewhere that was not connected to him.
translation.ko: 자기한테 연결되지 않는 번호로 전화를 거느라고요

translation.en: [Dorroh] We had tied him into a number of other cases across the country.
translation.ko: 우린 타일러를 전국의 여러 사건과 연결했어요

translation.en: We had five LAX bomb threats that he was responsible for.
translation.ko: 그는 LA 국제공항에 다섯 번이나 폭탄 협박 전화를 걸었죠

translation.en: At one point I tied him into seven in one week.
He would change his script along the way,
but it was the voice that we always came back to.
translation.ko: 목소리를 들어 보면 늘 타일러 배리스였죠

translation.en: [Koerner] They'd go and arrest Tyler at the house in Chatsworth.
[Koerner] Ultimately, Tyler Barriss pleads no contest to the charges,
translation.ko: 결국 타일러 배리스는 모든 혐의를 인정했고

translation.en: and is sentenced to approximately two years in the Los Angeles County Jail.
translation.ko: 로스앤젤레스 카운티 감옥에서 약 2년 형을 살게 됐죠

translation.en: His grandmother, fearing for her own life,
had taken out a restraining order against him.
[Barriss] It was my first time ever being in jail. Everything was all new to me.
translation.ko: 감옥 생활은 처음이라서 모든 게 낯설었어요

translation.en: I wasn't worried or scared.
It was more like, "Okay, well, my bail was a million dollars,
translation.ko: 걱정되거나 무섭진 않았어요 그냥 보석금이 백만 달러니까

translation.en: and I'm stuck in this situation."
So, it just was what it was.
I was just doing the time until I ended up getting out.
I got released from the county jail after 16 months.
It was 2:00 a.m. when I finally stepped foot outside.
I had nowhere to go.
I didn't have anywhere to stay. I didn't know anyone in LA.
translation.ko: 지낼 곳도 없고 LA에 아는 사람도 없었죠

translation.en: [Barriss] My grandmother, she had already told me not to go back.
But I don't know how to be homeless
and survive in the streets and do all that.
I just went back to the only place that I knew, which was my house.
translation.ko: 제가 아는 유일한 곳 집으로 돌아갔어요

translation.en: All the doors were locked and I just camped out back all night,
translation.ko: 문은 다 잠겨 있었죠 그래서 밤새 마당에 있었어요

translation.en: until about 6:00 a.m.
I've lived with her my whole life. I know what her routine is.
translation.ko: 평생 같이 살아서 할머니 일과를 알거든요

translation.en: I kind of just hung out in the backyard
until she unlocked the back door to do some laundry.
And I just walked in the house.
She was kind of shocked that I was there,
and she told me that I wasn't supposed to be there.
He contacted the grandmother, a violation of the restraining order.
translation.ko: 타일러는 할머니를 찾아가 접근 금지 명령을 어겼고

translation.en: And we put him right back in custody again.
Tyler lives in his own little world.
He doesn't have any real-world friends.
He doesn't have any employers or anything along those lines.
translation.ko: 어디 고용된 적도 없고 아예 일한 경험이 없어요

translation.en: So I think his only lifeline that he has is his grandmother
and he spoiled that relationship.
[Koerner] Tyler was then in jail from January 2017 to August 2017.
It makes you really sad to, like, grow up with somebody
translation.ko: 같이 자란 사람이 그렇게 변하다니 슬퍼요

translation.en: and be really close with them for such a long time,
and next thing you know, they're in jail and their whole life is upside-down,
translation.ko: 어느샌가 감옥에 갇혀 인생이 엉망이 되고

translation.en: and you don't recognize who's in front of you anymore.
We kind of lost contact and I moved on with my life.
translation.ko: 우린 연락이 끊겼고 전 제 인생을 살아갔어요

translation.en: [Koerner] When Tyler is released,
he finds a homeless shelter to live in near Exposition Park in Los Angeles.
translation.ko: LA 엑스포지션 공원 근처의 노숙자 쉼터를 찾았죠

translation.en: He ends up spending all his time going to a library near the homeless shelter.
translation.ko: 그리고 그 쉼터 근처 도서관에서 시간을 보내게 됐어요

translation.en: [Dorroh] He goes right back to doing what he believes he's singularly best at.
translation.ko: 다시 자기가 제일 잘한다고 믿는 일로 돌아갔죠

translation.en: [Dorroh] He was using his cell phone on the public Wi-Fi system
to make these calls.
And he would do it for a variety of reasons.
Sometimes he would do it for pay.
[Koerner] This is a person who's never held a traditional job,
translation.ko: 이 사람은 보통 직업을 가져 본 적이 없고

translation.en: and maybe lacks a lot of the skills necessary to do so.
[interviewer] How much were you making per swat?
[Barriss] I was charging people depending on how much of a stranger they were to me,
anywhere from $20 to $50 per swat.
But, quite frankly, I enjoyed the thrill of swatting.
translation.ko: 하지만 솔직히 전 스와팅의 스릴을 즐겼어요

translation.en: I just enjoyed doing it.
Having it appear on the news and then bragging about it on Twitter.
translation.ko: "보스턴 25에 기술 결함 발생" 뉴스에 나오고 트위터에 자랑하면서요

translation.en: [interviewer] Yeah.
[Barriss] I just, for whatever reason, enjoyed doing that.
translation.ko: "폭스 뉴스, 기술 결함 맞아?" 이유 불문하고 즐겼죠 "대피한 거 아니고?"

translation.en: [911 operator] Hi, what's going on?
[Barriss] My dad, he's going crazy, he's got his gun out.
translation.ko: 아빠가 미쳐 날뛰며 총을 꺼냈어요 "2017년 가을"

translation.en: [Dorroh] He enjoyed swatting people. It was his form of entertainment.
translation.ko: "스와팅 피해자의 경험담" 그는 스와팅을 즐겼고 그게 오락이었어요 "대피를 경험한 심경"

translation.en: [Barriss] Yeah, I left some bombs at my high school
and they're gonna blow up in 15 minutes.
Just scared. I don't see why people would want to harm children.
translation.ko: 그냥 두렵고, 사람들이 왜 애들을 해치려는지 모르겠어요

translation.en: [Dorroh] He had about a dozen different Twitter handles.
He would post links to the news stories on it,
translation.ko: "고어드 튜터 36" 기사 링크를 올려요 "경찰과 FBI가 집에 출동"

translation.en: you know, as "proof," taking credit for it.
[reporter] We have new information on the bomb threat that led to an evacuation
translation.ko: 폭탄 협박에 대한 새 정보로 케이 베일리 허치슨 컨벤션 센터에 대피령이 내려졌죠

translation.en: of the Kay Bailey Hutchison Convention Center.
translation.ko: 케이 베일리 허치슨 컨벤션 센터에 대피령이 내려졌죠

translation.en: [man] We heard an alarm go off, like, ten times?
And they're like, "We need you to leave."
[Dorroh] During the time period that he was out of custody,
we found approximately 37 other cases
that he had called in bomb threats or swattings.
translation.ko: "사실무근으로 판명된 협박" 폭탄 협박이나 스와팅을 했죠 "폭발물 안 나온 월마트"

translation.en: [Barriss] I'm upset with some people.
They got me mad, so now they're going to pay for it.
translation.ko: 제 성질을 건드렸으니 대가를 치러야 해요

translation.en: And I also have a gun too.
[Dorroh] He was like a one-man wrecking crew.
He was just out of control.
[Koerner] A couple weeks later,
the Federal Communications Commission in Washington, DC
translation.ko: 워싱턴 DC에서 연방 통신 위원회 FCC가

translation.en: is having a very key meeting about the future of net neutrality.
translation.ko: 망 중립성의 미래에 대한 중요한 회의를 했어요

translation.en: [Barriss] The FCC, broadcasting the vote on net neutrality live on Twitter
translation.ko: FCC는 망 중립성 투표를 트위터에 생중계했어요

translation.en: had like 160,000 viewers, at the time.
translation.ko: "스트리밍 중 12월 공개 회의" 당시 16만 명이 지켜봤죠

translation.en: And it was a federal building,
a little bit more high profile than some of my other evacuations.
So I posted on Twitter that I was gonna evacuate that building.
translation.ko: "FCC 회의 중 대피 예정 화내지 마" 그래서 거기 대피령을 내린다고 트위터에 예고했어요

translation.en: On advice of security, we need to take a brief recess.
translation.ko: "아지트 파이 FCC 의장" 보안팀 조언에 따라 잠시 휴정합니다

translation.en: [Koerner] This is a huge issue the FCC is considering, of national importance.
translation.ko: 이건 FCC가 다루는 국가적으로 중요한 사안이에요

translation.en: And Tyler is well aware of the importance to his community,
translation.ko: 타일러도 자기 커뮤니티에 중요한 일이라는 걸 알았죠

translation.en: to gamers in particular.
And once again, he takes credit for this and laughs about it.
translation.ko: "FCC 망 중립성 토론 중 휴정" 타일러는 또 자기 짓이라고 밝히며 비웃었죠 "보안상 이유"

translation.en: He takes great pride that his power now extends to the halls of government.
translation.ko: 자기 힘이 정부에도 미친다는 사실에 자부심을 느꼈어요 "경찰은 어디 있어?"

translation.en: [Barriss] I wasn't trying to scare them out of voting or whatever was going on.
translation.ko: 그들을 겁줘서 투표나 회의를 망칠 생각은 없었어요

translation.en: That didn't concern me.
translation.ko: 그거랑 상관없이 제 트위터가 주목받으려고 그랬죠

translation.en: I just knew it was gonna bring my Twitter a lot of attention.
translation.ko: 그거랑 상관없이 제 트위터가 주목받으려고 그랬죠 "FCC랑 게임 리그 스와팅 했는데 안 걸림"

translation.en: And my Twitter was quite popular that day.
Gamers and hackers and people doing dark criminal stuff online.
translation.ko: 게이머와 해커, 그리고 인터넷에서 나쁜 짓 하는 사람들

translation.en: My Twitter was quite popular in that scene of individuals.
translation.ko: 제 트위터는 그런 사람들한테 꽤 유명했죠

translation.en: Whoever it is running this Twitter is swatting and evacuating everything.
translation.ko: 이 트위터 운영자가 누구든 사방에 스와팅 하고 대피령을 내린다고요

translation.en: [Dorroh] Since 2014, I had been investigating swatting cases more and more.
We all recognized, even the gaming community recognized it,
translation.ko: 우리는 물론이고 게임 업계에서도 위험 행위로 인식했죠

translation.en: as a dangerous practice.
But we never had that fatality and we were just kind of waiting for it.
translation.ko: 하지만 큰 피해가 없었기 때문에 그걸 기다렸어요

translation.en: We knew it was going to happen.
[Koerner] On December 28, 2017,
Shane Gaskill, who lives in Wichita, Kansas,
is playing Call of Duty with another gamer named Casey Viner,
translation.ko: 다른 게이머와 '콜 오브 듀티' 게임을 했어요 신시내티 외곽에 사는 케이시 바이너랑요

translation.en: who lives outside Cincinnati.
They're playing on a site
where you can actually win small amounts of money
translation.ko: 이기면 소액의 돈을 딸 수 있었어요

translation.en: for winning one of these games.
In the midst of all this violent chaos,
Shane Gaskill accidentally shoots Casey Viner's character to death.
translation.ko: 셰인 가스킬이 실수로 케이시 바이너의 캐릭터를 죽였죠

translation.en: [Koerner] They lose the game
and don't get the $1.50 wager that had been placed on the game.
Shane and Casey get into a huge dispute about this online,
translation.ko: 셰인과 케이시는 이 일로 온라인에서 설전을 벌였어요

translation.en: and Casey decides that he wants to take revenge on Shane Gaskill.
translation.ko: 그리고 케이시는 셰인 가스킬에게 복수하기로 했어요

translation.en: Casey knew exactly where to go.
And so he contacted "SWAuTistic" as Tyler was known online.
[Koerner] Shane Gaskill saw that "SWAuTistic" was now following him
to collect information.
And then Shane Gaskill sent a direct message to Tyler Barriss.
"Please try some shit. I'll be waiting."
"1033 West McCormick Street, Wichita, Kansas."
This is a person telling the ostensibly most feared swatter
translation.ko: 그는 제일 강력한 스와팅 가해자에게 "안녕, 쫄보가 지껄이네"

translation.en: that he doesn't have the balls to go through with it.
Tyler kind of had a God complex. His ego was really big.
translation.ko: 타일러는 신 콤플렉스가 있었어요 굉장히 자존심이 강했죠

translation.en: [Barriss] People are actually ignorant and arrogant enough to give you their address
translation.ko: 사람들은 주소를 알려 줄 만큼 무지하고 건방져요

translation.en: and tell you to come do something.
[911 operator] This is 911. What's going on?
[Barriss] My mom and dad, they were arguing and I shot him in the head.
translation.ko: 엄마랑 아빠가 싸워서 제가 아빠 머리를 쐈는데

translation.en: And he's not breathing anymore.
[911 operator] Do you have any weapons on you?
[Barriss] Yeah, I do. A handgun.
[911 operator] Okay. What's your address?
[Barriss] It's 1033 West McCormick Street.
[Koerner] The problem is, Shane Gaskill had given the wrong address.
translation.ko: 문제는 셰인 가스킬이 가짜 주소를 줬다는 거죠

translation.en: It wasn't Shane's house.
And the people who actually lived in the house at that time
was the Finch family.
[Francis Finch] Andrew Finch is my mom's brother.
October 27th, 2002,
my mother got into a car crash
on her way to Texas to get me and my sister.
translation.ko: 저희 남매를 데리러 텍사스로 가던 길에요

translation.en: She rolled three times in her truck and was pronounced dead on scene.
translation.ko: 엄마는 차를 탄 채 세 번 굴렀고 현장에서 즉사했어요

translation.en: I was like one or two, I believe. Andrew was like, maybe 16 or 17.
I believe that he had felt he had a duty to take care of me and my sister.
translation.ko: 삼촌은 저희 남매에게 책임감을 느꼈나 봐요

translation.en: He taught me a lot of the things that I know now.
translation.ko: "앤드루 핀치" 삼촌한테 많은 걸 배웠죠 "프랜시스 핀치"

translation.en: And that's why I regard him as my father
is because I feel like a father's duty
is to teach a young man how to… be a man in life.
translation.ko: 아빠가 아들에게 가르쳐 주잖아요 남자가 되는 법을요

translation.en: [Ali Abdelhadi] Andy actually cooked dinner for us.
That day he made pasta with tomato sauce with cheese
translation.ko: 토마토소스랑 치즈를 넣은 파스타였죠 "알리 아브델하디 핀치 가족의 친구"

translation.en: and big pork chops.
We were just relaxing, chilling,
translation.ko: 우리는 느긋하게 있었어요 "리사 핀치 앤드루 모친"

translation.en: because it was just a few days past Christmas.
There was a paved alley right against the house
where there was this huge pothole.
[Abdelhadi] When I heard one vehicle, didn't seem odd. It happens all the time.
translation.ko: 차 소리가 나서 그런가 보다 했죠 늘 있는 일이니까요

translation.en: [Lisa] Andy got up to see who was there.
By this point, police had surrounded the house.
translation.ko: 그때는 경찰이 집을 포위한 후였어요 "메코 헤이즈 독립 취재 기자"

translation.en: And Andrew opens the door
and he's caught by police lights,
officers all over to the east of the house,
to the west of the house, directly in front of the house.
[Lisa] He didn't know who was there for him. You know, he didn't know.
translation.ko: 앤드루는 누가 왔는지 몰랐어요 전혀 몰랐죠

translation.en: [officer 1] Hey, front door! Hands!
-[officer 2] Show your hands! -[officer 1] He's right there.
[officer 3] Walk this way!
[Abdelhadi] I started hearing commands from everywhere.
I didn't exactly make them out.
Shouting.
[Haze] And in the seven seconds of opening the door,
an officer pulled the trigger on his AR-15…
…and shot Andrew once from, I believe, it was 67 yards away.
[Abdelhadi] He was on his face, barely able to breathe.
And on his face and laid out in front of the front door
to the inside of the house.
That's when Lisa came out.
She goes, "I heard Andy scream. What's going on?"
I said, "I don't know. I'm getting ready to find out."
I'm looking at him, possibly dying,
couldn't tell her that.
Figured the next shot might be coming at me.
I didn't know who was shooting.
And then they're on their intercom saying,
"Everyone get out from the east side."
[Lisa] Telling us to come out with our hands up.
[Haze] Dispatch was actually still on the phone with Tyler at this point.
Tyler actually stayed on the phone with 911 for 16 minutes after the shooting.
-[Barriss] Hello? -[911 operator] I'm still here, okay?
[Barriss] Yeah, me too.
[Haze] Despite them still being on phone with the alleged hostage-taker,
the family was dragged outside, barefoot, handcuffed.
The family was basically treated as criminals,
while WPD tore through the house.
[Barriss] My dad isn't breathing.
It's kind of giving me anxiety and making me, like, paranoid.
[Abdelhadi] They kept asking us, "Who else is up there?"
translation.ko: 경찰은 계속 또 누가 있냐고 물었죠

translation.en: So we're confused at that point.
We didn't know what happened, why they were there.
translation.ko: 무슨 상황인지 경찰이 왜 왔는지 몰랐죠

translation.en: I kept saying, "Why are you guys here?"
But their confusion was even more than our confusion.
They couldn't tell us what's going on.
They kept asking who else was in the house.
[Francis] I was at my friend Isaac's house
and I started getting these texts, like, "Are you okay?"
"There's cops at your house." "Hey, are you good?"
"Do you know what's going on?"
I'm just, "I don't know. I'm not at my house right now."
And then like an hour goes by, maybe two,
translation.ko: 그리고 한두 시간 후에 기사가 쏟아졌어요

translation.en: articles start coming out, "Man shot at 1033 West McCormick."
translation.ko: 그리고 한두 시간 후에 기사가 쏟아졌어요 '웨스트 매코믹가 1033번지에서 남성 피격'

translation.en: "Unidentified man shot at--"
I almost-- like, the moment I saw "Man shot at…" I…
I almost knew, like, automatically.
And that's when I found out it was him.
I just like, dropped down to my knees at that point,
not being able to breathe.
I remember… almost forgetting, like, to inhale.
translation.ko: 숨 쉬는 걸 잊어버렸던 기억이 나요

translation.en: I just sat there in disbelief.
[Haze] Andrew's niece Adelina lived with the family.
translation.ko: 앤드루의 조카 에이델리나는 가족과 함께 살았어요

translation.en: I believe she was 17 at the time of the shooting.
She was actually forced to step over Andrew
as he was laying on the floor, bleeding out and gasping for air.
translation.ko: 바닥에서 피 흘리며 숨을 헐떡이는 삼촌을요

translation.en: [Francis] They left him there on the ground until all of it was over with.
translation.ko: 경찰은 조사가 끝날 때까지 삼촌을 그대로 방치했죠

translation.en: So she had to walk over his body,
and look at him and see him,
and then get handcuffed outside.
[Haze] Andrew laid there for roughly 15 to 20 minutes
before receiving any medical attention whatsoever.
translation.ko: 겨우 치료든 뭐든 받을 수 있었어요

translation.en: Officers were actually told to not move the body,
and step over him,
and ambulance was on-scene, and the ambulance was held back.
translation.ko: 구급차도 현장에 있었지만 대기 명령을 받았어요

translation.en: Instead of going to the hospital with their family member,
they were taken downtown for questioning.
[Abdelhadi] In the interrogation room, the detective said,
"Would you know of someone that is holding a grudge against you or the house
translation.ko: '당신이나 이 집에 원한을 가진 사람이 있나요?'

translation.en: that would actually make a false call to create chaos?"
I said, "Not necessarily, no, why?"
"You haven't told me, how is Andy?"
"'Cause I know when I saw him inside the house,
he was having a hard time breathing."
"Did he get better? Did they take him to the hospital?"
He said, "I am very sorry, Ali, but he did not survive his wounds."
translation.ko: 형사는 정말 안타깝지만 앤디는 회복하지 못했다고 했죠

translation.en: [Lisa] I did not cry. I did not get hysterical.
I became determined
and was going to do what I needed to
to make sure this was handled.
For justice.
You know, I didn't know if I was going to be able to uphold myself
